about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: In which of the following scenarios should your wheels not be pointed straight ahead?

about.name: In which of the following scenarios should your wheels not be pointed straight ahead?

hasPart.assesses: In which of the following scenarios should your wheels not be pointed straight ahead? | In which of the following scenarios should your wheels not be pointed straight ahead? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: While waiting to turn left, keep your wheels pointed straight ahead until it is safe to start your turn. If a vehicle hits you from behind, this will prevent you from veering into oncoming traffic. When parked facing either uphill or downhill, turn the wheels so the vehicle will not roll into traffic if the brakes fail.

suggestedAnswer.text: When waiting to make a left turn at a traffic light.

comment.text: When waiting to make a left turn at a traffic light.

suggestedAnswer.text: When parked on a hill or sloping driveway.

comment.text: When parked on a hill or sloping driveway.

suggestedAnswer.text: When parked on the side of a level roadway where there is no curb.

comment.text: When parked on the side of a level roadway where there is no curb.

acceptedAnswer.text: When parked on a hill or sloping driveway.

comment.text: When parked on a hill or sloping driveway.

answerExplanation.text: While waiting to turn left, keep your wheels pointed straight ahead until it is safe to start your turn. If a vehicle hits you from behind, this will prevent you from veering into oncoming traffic. When parked facing either uphill or downhill, turn the wheels so the vehicle will not roll into traffic if the brakes fail.

comment.text: In which of the following scenarios should your wheels not be pointed straight ahead? | While waiting to turn left, keep your wheels pointed straight ahead until it is safe to start your turn. If a vehicle hits you from behind, this will prevent you from veering into oncoming traffic. When parked facing either uphill or downhill, turn the wheels so the vehicle will not roll into traffic if the brakes fail.

hasPart.name: When driving in fog, rain, or snow, use:

about.name: When driving in fog, rain, or snow, use:

hasPart.assesses: When driving in fog, rain, or snow, use: | When driving in fog, rain, or snow, use: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Low beam headlights should be used in fog, rain, and snow. The light from high beams will reflect back to the driver under these weather conditions, causing a glare that will make it difficult to see ahead.

comment.text: Low beams.
High beams.
Fog lights only.
Low beams.

answerExplanation.text: Low beam headlights should be used in fog, rain, and snow. The light from high beams will reflect back to the driver under these weather conditions, causing a glare that will make it difficult to see ahead.

comment.text: When driving in fog, rain, or snow, use: | Low beam headlights should be used in fog, rain, and snow. The light from high beams will reflect back to the driver under these weather conditions, causing a glare that will make it difficult to see ahead.

hasPart.name: When you see this sign, you:

about.name: When you see this sign, you:

hasPart.assesses: When you see this sign, you: | When you see this sign, you: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: This sign indicates that you are approaching a railroad crossing. You must look, listen, slow down, and prepare to stop. Wait for any trains to pass before you proceed.

suggestedAnswer.text: Are approaching a railroad crossing and should prepare to stop.

comment.text: Are approaching a railroad crossing and should prepare to stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: Will always stop at the upcoming railroad crossing.

comment.text: Will always stop at the upcoming railroad crossing.

suggestedAnswer.text: Should stop and wait for a signal before crossing the railroad tracks.

comment.text: Should stop and wait for a signal before crossing the railroad tracks.

acceptedAnswer.text: Are approaching a railroad crossing and should prepare to stop.

comment.text: Are approaching a railroad crossing and should prepare to stop.

answerExplanation.text: This sign indicates that you are approaching a railroad crossing. You must look, listen, slow down, and prepare to stop. Wait for any trains to pass before you proceed.

comment.text: When you see this sign, you: | This sign indicates that you are approaching a railroad crossing. You must look, listen, slow down, and prepare to stop. Wait for any trains to pass before you proceed.

hasPart.name: If a truck or bus is making a right turn where you also need to make a right turn, you should:

about.name: If a truck or bus is making a right turn where you also need to make a right turn, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If a truck or bus is making a right turn where you also need to make a right turn, you should: | If a truck or bus is making a right turn where you also need to make a right turn, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If you try to insert your vehicle between a turning truck or bus and a curb, you may suffer a serious crash. To avoid a collision, do not turn until the truck or bus has completed its turn.

suggestedAnswer.text: Quickly turn before the truck or bus is able to.

comment.text: Quickly turn before the truck or bus is able to.

suggestedAnswer.text: Wait until the truck or bus turns before you turn.

comment.text: Wait until the truck or bus turns before you turn.

suggestedAnswer.text: Squeeze between the truck or bus and the curb.

comment.text: Squeeze between the truck or bus and the curb.

acceptedAnswer.text: Wait until the truck or bus turns before you turn.

comment.text: Wait until the truck or bus turns before you turn.

answerExplanation.text: If you try to insert your vehicle between a turning truck or bus and a curb, you may suffer a serious crash. To avoid a collision, do not turn until the truck or bus has completed its turn.

comment.text: If a truck or bus is making a right turn where you also need to make a right turn, you should: | If you try to insert your vehicle between a turning truck or bus and a curb, you may suffer a serious crash. To avoid a collision, do not turn until the truck or bus has completed its turn.

hasPart.assesses: You should increase the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle ahead when you: | You should increase the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle ahead when you: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When being tailgated, create extra space in front of your vehicle and do not brake suddenly. Slow down gradually or merge into another lane to prevent a collision with the tailgater.

suggestedAnswer.text: Are following a small passenger vehicle.

comment.text: Are following a small passenger vehicle.

suggestedAnswer.text: Are being tailgated by another driver.

comment.text: Are being tailgated by another driver.

suggestedAnswer.text: Are driving more slowly than the posted speed limit.

comment.text: Are driving more slowly than the posted speed limit.

acceptedAnswer.text: Are being tailgated by another driver.

comment.text: Are being tailgated by another driver.

answerExplanation.text: When being tailgated, create extra space in front of your vehicle and do not brake suddenly. Slow down gradually or merge into another lane to prevent a collision with the tailgater.

comment.text: You should increase the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle ahead when you: | When being tailgated, create extra space in front of your vehicle and do not brake suddenly. Slow down gradually or merge into another lane to prevent a collision with the tailgater.

hasPart.name: When driving under snowy or icy conditions:

about.name: When driving under snowy or icy conditions:

hasPart.assesses: When driving under snowy or icy conditions: | When driving under snowy or icy conditions: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When driving under snowy or icy conditions, you should make speed and directional changes gradually. Never use cruise control when driving on snow or ice because your tires may lose contact with the road and you will lose control of your vehicle.

suggestedAnswer.text: It is safe to use your cruise control.

comment.text: It is safe to use your cruise control.

suggestedAnswer.text: Make speed and directional changes more gradually than you would otherwise.

comment.text: Make speed and directional changes more gradually than you would otherwise.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drive as you would under normal conditions.

comment.text: Drive as you would under normal conditions.

acceptedAnswer.text: Make speed and directional changes more gradually than you would otherwise.

comment.text: Make speed and directional changes more gradually than you would otherwise.

answerExplanation.text: When driving under snowy or icy conditions, you should make speed and directional changes gradually. Never use cruise control when driving on snow or ice because your tires may lose contact with the road and you will lose control of your vehicle.

comment.text: When driving under snowy or icy conditions: | When driving under snowy or icy conditions, you should make speed and directional changes gradually. Never use cruise control when driving on snow or ice because your tires may lose contact with the road and you will lose control of your vehicle.
